text: God Has Ordained the Ebb and Flow of Human Activities
For everything there \add is\add* an appointed time, a time for every matter under heaven:
a time to bear\f + \fr 3:2 \ft Or “a time to be born”; MT reads the active form “to bear \fq children \ft ” \f* and a time to die;
a time to plant and a time to root up \add what is\add* planted;
a time to kill and a time to heal;
a time to break down and a time to build up;
a time to weep and a time to laugh;
a time to mourn and a time to dance;
a time to throw away stones and a time to gather stones;
a time to embrace and a time to refrain from embracing;
a time to seek and a time to lose;
a time to keep and a time to throw away;
a time to tear and a time to sew;
a time to be silent and a time to speak;
a time to love and a time to hate;
a time \add for\add* war and a time \add for\add* peace.
What does the worker gain in his toil?
No One Understands God’s Mysterious Plan
I have seen the busyness God gives to ⸤humans⸥\f + \fr 3:10 \ft Literally “the sons of the man” \f* to preoccupy\f + \fr 3:10 \ft Or “to be busy” \f* them.
He has made everything suitable in its time. He also has put ⸤the past⸥\f + \fr 3:11 \ft Literally “eternity” \f* in their hearts, yet no one can grasp what God does from the beginning to the end.

So I realized that there is ⸤nothing better⸥\f + \fr 3:12 \ft Literally “no good” \f* for them than to ⸤rejoice and enjoy themselves⸥\f + \fr 3:12 \ft Literally “to rejoice and to do good” \f* during their lives.
And for anyone to eat and drink, that is, ⸤to enjoy the fruit of all his toil⸥,\f + \fr 3:13 \ft Literally “to see good in all his toil” \f* this also is a gift of God.
I know everything God does endures forever;
nothing can be added to it, and nothing can be taken from it,
for God so acts that humans\f + \fr 3:14 \ft Or “they” \f* might stand in awe before him.
What is—it already was,
and what will be—it already is,
for ⸤God will do what he has done.⸥\f + \fr 3:15 \ft Literally “God seeks \fq what \ft is pursued” \f*
God’s Mysterious Plan Allows Injustice to Exist in the World
I saw something else under the sun: instead of justice \add there was\add* evil; instead of righteousness \add there was\add* wickedness.

So I said ⸤to myself⸥,\f + \fr 3:17 \ft Literally “in my heart” \f* “God will surely judge the righteous and the wicked, for he has appointed\f + \fr 3:17 \ft The MT reads שָׁם “there,” but repointing to שָׂם, “he has appointed,” makes better sense \f* a time \add of judgment\add* for every deed and every work.”

I said to myself concerning ⸤humans⸥,\f + \fr 3:18 \ft Literally “the sons of the man” \f* “God sifts\f + \fr 3:18 \ft Or “tests” \f* them in order to show\f + \fr 3:18 \ft The MT reads active “to see,” but causative “to show” is reflected by LXX, Syriac Peshitta, and Latin Vulgate \f* them that they are like beasts.”

For the fate of ⸤humans⸥\f + \fr 3:19 \ft Literally “the sons of the man” \f* and the fate of the beast is ⸤the same⸥.\f + \fr 3:19 \ft Literally “\fq is \ft one” \f* The death of the one is like the death of the other, for ⸤both are mortal⸥.\f + \fr 3:19 \ft Literally “and one breath \fq is \ft for all” \f* Man has no advantage over the beast, for both are fleeting.
Both go to one place—both came from dust and both return to dust.
For no one knows \add whether\add* the spirit of a human ascends \add to heaven\add* and \add whether\add* the spirit of the beast descends to the ground!

So I concluded that there is nothing better for a person than to enjoy \add the fruit of\add* his labor, for this is his lot in life. ⸤For no one knows what will happen in the future.⸥\f + \fr 3:22 \ft Literally “For who can bring him to see in what will be after him?” \f*
